definitions.text: a powerful stroke with the fist or a weapon
examples: a blow on the head

definitions.text: an impact (as from a collision)
examples: the bump threw him off the bicycle

definitions.text: an unfortunate happening that hinders or impedes; something that is thwarting or frustrating
an unpleasant or disappointing surprise
examples: it came as a shock to learn that he was injured

definitions.text: a strong current of air
examples: the tree was bent almost double by the gust

definitions.text: street names for cocaine
forceful exhalation through the nose or mouth
examples: he gave his nose a loud blow
he blew out all the candles with a single puff

definitions.text: exhale hard
examples: blow on the soup to cool it down

definitions.text: be blowing or storming
examples: The wind blew from the West

definitions.text: free of obstruction by blowing air through
examples: blow one's nose

definitions.text: be in motion due to some air or water current
examples: The leaves were blowing in the wind
the boat drifted on the lake
The sailboat was adrift on the open sea
the shipwrecked boat drifted away from the shore

definitions.text: make a sound as if blown
examples: The whistle blew

definitions.text: shape by blowing
examples: Blow a glass vase

definitions.text: make a mess of, destroy or ruin
examples: I botched the dinner and we had to eat out
the pianist screwed up the difficult passage in the second movement

definitions.text: spend thoughtlessly; throw away
examples: He wasted his inheritance on his insincere friends
You squandered the opportunity to get and advanced degree

definitions.text: spend lavishly or wastefully on
examples: He blew a lot of money on his new home theater

definitions.text: sound by having air expelled through a tube
examples: The trumpets blew

definitions.text: play or sound a wind instrument
examples: She blew the horn

definitions.text: provide sexual gratification through oral stimulation
cause air to go in, on, or through
examples: Blow my hair dry

definitions.text: cause to move by means of an air current
examples: The wind blew the leaves around in the yard

definitions.text: spout moist air from the blowhole
examples: The whales blew

definitions.text: leave; informal or rude
examples: shove off!
The children shoved along
Blow now!

definitions.text: lay eggs
examples: certain insects are said to blow

definitions.text: cause to be revealed and jeopardized
examples: The story blew their cover
The double agent was blown by the other side

definitions.text: show off
allow to regain its breath
examples: blow a horse

definitions.text: melt, break, or become otherwise unusable
examples: The lightbulbs blew out
The fuse blew

definitions.text: burst suddenly
examples: The tire blew
We blew a tire
